comments: Very boring class and monotone. Great guy during office hours but depending on the day in lecture he can be cranky. TA helped WAY more than he did, kind of uptight. Class overall easy. 3 weekly responses every week each 170 characters and 6 exams, drops 2 lowest. No hard to get an A. Lot of busy work for sure and reading -- lots of reading!

He\'s very nice, & will try to explain answers to any questions you have. Unlike other teachers who demand the correct answer, he wants as much participation as possible & says "there\'s no wrong/right answer."There\'s only two tests, and 4 written book analysis. A LOT of assigned readings! Read as much as you can to get your daily participation pts.
This is the most boring class I\'ve ever had. Six exams and quizes every week. No review session or study guide for the exam. Grading was extremely arbitrary.

Class was alright. 3 short responses due a week (700 CHARACTERS), test/quiz questions straight off powerpoints, attendance is pretty much mandatory b/c you have an in-class question (answer in groups) due everyday. But overall, somewhat easy class. But boring and a lot of busy work. No papers but 1 EASYY group project (annotated bibliography)

This class is extremely painful to sit through. There\'s a reading response and an in-class exercise due each day & full points are not always awarded. He does not give study guides for exams nor does he review the chapter before the test. DO NOT TAKE CHINESE CIV!
This is one of those classes that painful to get through. Three readings per week. There are 6 exams and 12 quizzes. Boring class, dont take it.

Dont take this class. The TA said this class becomes much harder than before. Three responds per week and usually you can not get full credits. Sometimes they give you very low grades without even a word feedback. This is a very horrible class, painful to get through and extremely boring. DONT TAKE IT IF YOU DONT HAVE TO.

Soft-spoken and exceedingly knowledgeable, Professor Giele is one of the best U of A has to offer. Giele takes a difficult subject such as Classical Chinese and makes it enjoyable to participate and study. He will go out of his way to make you comfortable seeking any sort of clarification and is generous on his exams.

Great guy, very straightforward with the material. Can be a little dry if no one interacts, but a great class if you\'re involved. Knows his stuff. ... Completely unrelated to his teaching methods, but interesting- interesting way of pronouncing/using words. I\'d recommend his classes.

Chinese Civ is already a boring subject in itself. Professor Giele is VERY monotone which doesn\'t help. When approached he can be unfriendly or nice depending on the day. It\'s impportant to go to EVERY lecture to hand in a reading response. Quizzes are very easy. Midterm is curved and if you study the final is easy. I wouldn\'t take this class again

Professor Giele is a very sweet man. The easy tests and reading responses make up for his somewhat monotone voice. He posts all of his slides online and usually goes over information before we take a quiz each Friday. Take this class; if you read and attend, you will get an A.

This class was one of those classes that are painful to get through EVERY DAY. There are 2 readings a week that you have to write about a paragraph about and turn it, and a quiz every Friday. He\'s not very nice when approached, and his slides are really bad. Don\'t take Chinese Civ!

Easy A. Only 2 tests, the midterm and final. Answers to tests straight forward. 3 readings a week, with a 3 sentence response to each. Turn it in for full points. Discussion session every friday an easy quiz. Easy A as long as you go to every class throughout the semester.
